item.title: Report E-2023100219
item.description:
Report E-2023100219

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-12
  • City: PASCO
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one case of camp fuel (un1268) had been damaged by other freight and had released 1 gallon of product from one of the metal inner one gallon cans. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Wet box brought to QA. DescribePack: Found that cap on plastic bottle of Sink & Surface Cleaner Sanitizer was loose and some of the liquid spilled out into the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Closed the lid tightly.

item.title: Report X-2023070331
item.description:
Report X-2023070331

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-14T00:31:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-20
  • City: TACOMA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Denatured ethanol leaking from defective pressure relief device on tank car. Unknown amount (1 lbs) to car sides. Car crew member reported some spilling from top of car last night but TM couldn't find any evidence of spill during day. No waterways, no injuries. USE doing tank car inspection found defective PRD. PRD was found stuck in to the open position, responders were able to reset the valve. Shipper was notified of defective PRD. A transload is schedule so the empty car can move to destination for repair/inspection. All spill ethanol evaporated from the tank car body, no impacts to soil.
